newsitem.title: GERMANY: TENNIS-BECKER SAYS DEFEAT RAISES HIS WIMBLEDON CHANCES.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-BECKER SAYS DEFEAT RAISES HIS WIMBLEDON CHANCES.

text.p: Boris Becker said on Sunday he hated losing in the semifinals of a grasscourt tournament in Germany on Saturday but the defeat might boost his chances of recapturing the Wimbledon title.
"The loss hurts but it will also have a positive effect," Becker said a day after Yevgeny Kafelnikov defeated him in straight sets in the semifinals of the $875,000 grasscourt tournament in Halle.

"If I had won the title here people would have expected too much from me in Wimbledon," said the 29-year-old Becker, who was Wimbledon champion in 1985, 1986 and 1989. "Besides, not winning here makes me all the more hungry for success. I am far from satiated."
Becker, whose world ranking slipped from 13 to 18 with the loss on Saturday, will travel to London this week to begin preparing for his 14th consecutive Wimbledon appearance.
"I become a completely different player on grass," said the German, who has won 49 tournaments in his career. "My opponents are more afraid of me. That raises my self-confidence."
